intro: Acinos acutifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acino, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing its resilience to harsh conditions. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. Its ecological importance lies in providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
